name: Jerry Seinfeld
description: The observational comedian at the center of the group, known for his wry wit, dating neuroses, and often bemused reactions to his friends' antics.

name: George Costanza
description: Jerry's neurotic, insecure, and perpetually unlucky best friend. A master of lying, manipulation, and self-sabotage, often characterized by his baldness and cheapness.

name: Elaine Benes
description: Jerry's ex-girlfriend and close friend, known for her strong opinions, distinct bad dance moves, and frequently tumultuous career and relationships.

name: Cosmo Kramer
description: Jerry's eccentric, lanky, and enigmatic neighbor, known for his wild hair, distinctive entrance, bizarre schemes, and frequent physical comedy.

name: Newman
description: Jerry's corpulent arch-nemesis and Kramer's best friend. A scheming, lazy, and often villainous mailman who lives across the hall from Jerry.

name: Frank Costanza
description: George's loud, short-tempered, and highly opinionated father, known for creating the holiday Festivus and his love for various quirky endeavors.

name: Estelle Costanza
description: George's dramatic, overbearing, and equally loud mother, constantly complaining about Frank and George's life choices with a distinctive nasal voice.

name: Susan Ross
description: George's fianc√©e who tragically dies from licking cheap, toxic wedding invitations. She was a calm and patient counterpoint to George's neuroses.

name: Mr. Wilhelm
occupation: Assistant to the Traveling Secretary (New York Yankees)
description: George's oblivious and soft-spoken boss at the New York Yankees, who often misunderstands George's bizarre behavior and assigns him peculiar tasks.

name: J. Peterman
description: Elaine's eccentric and adventurous boss, a world traveler known for his verbose storytelling, exotic anecdotes, and unusual requests.

name: David Puddy
description: Elaine's on-again, off-again, mostly monosyllabic, and deeply religious boyfriend, known for his "high-five" and affinity for Arby's.

name: Jackie Chiles
description: Kramer's flamboyant and highly litigious lawyer, a parody of Johnnie Cochran, known for his dramatic pronouncements and over-the-top legal strategies.

name: Morty Seinfeld
description: Jerry's frugal, opinionated father, living in Florida, known for his strong beliefs about money, his invented "Executive" raincoat, and his contempt for Newman.

name: Helen Seinfeld
description: Jerry's supportive and often exasperated mother, also living in Florida, who thinks everything Jerry does is "marvelous" and can't comprehend his friends' quirks.

name: Uncle Leo
description: Jerry's eccentric and overly affectionate uncle, known for his loud greetings ("Jerry! Hello!"), his dramatic hand gestures, and often petty grievances.

name: Mickey Abbott
description: Kramer's short-statured friend and aspiring actor, known for his fiery temper and disputes over his height, often seen in various costumes.

name: Tim Whatley
description: Jerry's dentist friend, known for converting to Judaism for the jokes, re-gifting, and possibly being a "re-gifter" of questionable gifts.

name: Yev Kassem (Soup Nazi)
description: A notoriously strict and tyrannical soup kitchen owner who has a strict ordering procedure and will ban customers for minor infractions. 'No soup for you!'

name: Babu Bhatt
description: A Pakistani immigrant who runs a struggling restaurant. Jerry gives him bad business advice, leading to his restaurant failing and ultimately his deportation.

name: Kenny Bania
description: A hack comedian who frequently annoys Jerry with his terrible jokes, attempts to mooch, and claims of being a 'professional comedian' and Jerry's 'mentor.'

name: Izzy Mandelbaum
description: An elderly, incredibly strong man and former fitness instructor, known for his catchphrase "It's go time!" and his bizarre physical challenges to Kramer.

name: Lt. Bookman
description: A cynical and hard-boiled library detective who confronts Jerry about an overdue book, delivering a memorable, poetic monologue about the importance of books.

name: Joe Davola
description: A psychotic writer and performance artist who develops an obsessive and violent grudge against Jerry, stalking him and causing various disturbances.

name: Poppie
description: An opinionated and often unsanitary elderly man who owns a restaurant and is involved in various mishaps with the gang, notably his bladder issues and anti-abortion stance.

name: Bob Cobb (The Maestro)
description: Elaine's pretentious and self-important boyfriend who insists on being called "Maestro" and claims to own a villa in Tuscany.

name: Sue Ellen Mischke
description: Elaine's old high school friend and a wealthy heiress who famously goes bra-less, causing a stir among the gang and a legal battle for Elaine.

name: Mr. Pitt
description: Elaine's demanding and eccentric boss at an import/export company, known for his unusual requests (like asking Elaine to pick out his socks) and an affinity for pencils.

name: Marcy
description: George's attractive girlfriend who decides to get a nose job, which George is surprisingly against after seeing the less-than-ideal results.

name: Sheila
description: Jerry's girlfriend known for her soft, nearly inaudible speaking voice ('low talker'), forcing Jerry to constantly ask her to repeat herself.

name: Sid
description: A curmudgeonly and confrontational parking lot attendant who frequently has run-ins with George and other characters over parking disputes.
